TITLE.P: Outcomes Based Contract For Children At Risk Of Care (using a Social Impact Bond Structure)

SHORT_DESCR.P: Suffolk County Council are currently out to tender for the provision of Outcomes Based Contract For Children At Risk Of Care (using a Social Impact Bond Structure). This opportunity is available in the “Current Tenders” area of portal. Interested parties are invited to express their interest to gain full access to the tender documentation. The deadline date for submissions of the tender is 12:00 noon on 30.4.2018. Please note late returns will not be permitted Bidder Events on the 28th and 29th March, please see the ITT for further information or email Katrina.browning@suffolk.gov.uk
The deadline for clarification questions is 16.4.2018 which must be generated via the correspondence option on the website.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: Only one of the Lots will be awarded either Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3. We reserve the right to decide which Lot to award following the evaluation of the bids.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Social Investor and Service Provider who will deliver an Outcomes Based Contract For Children At Risk Of Care (using a Social Impact Bond Structure).

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Whether the contract is subject to renewal will depend on a number of factors including the success rate of this contract and whether funding is available.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Variant bids will only be considered if:
a) also accompanied by a compliant bid;
b) are for the Lots detailed; and
c) use the Social Impact Bond model.
Any variant bids which are received will be evaluated against the same award criteria as set for standard compliant bids.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Social Investor Only who working with Suffolk County Council will engage a service provider.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The potential renewal of the contract will be subject to a number of factors including the success rate of this contract and the availability of funding.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Variant bids will only be considered if:
a) also accompanied by a compliant bid;
b) are for the Lots detailed; and
c) use the Social Impact Bond model.
Any variant bids which are received will be evaluated against the same award criteria as set for standard compliant bids.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Service Provider Only who, working with Suffolk County Council will seek to secure the funding needed and Social Investor(s) to deliver the Oucomes Based Contract as a Social Impact Bond.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The potential Contract Renewal will be subject to a number of factors including the success rate of this contract and the availability of funding.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Variant bids will only be considered if:
a) also accompanied by a compliant bid;
b) are for the Lots detailed; and
c) use the Social Impact Bond model.
Any variant bids which are received will be evaluated against the same award criteria as set for standard compliant bids.

INFO_ADD.P: This procurement complies with the Light Touch Regime under the EU Procurement Rules and the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 and is an Open Competitive process with negotiation. Electronic ordering will be used, electronic invoicing will be accepted and electronic payment will be used. The Authority reserves the right to award a contract on the basis of initial tenders without negotiation. Suffolk County Council wishes to reduce the number of young people, typically aged 11-17, that need to enter Care (also known as becoming Looked After) and remain in Care. To do this Suffolk County Council wishes to commission, and work with, a Social Investor and Service Provider to set up a Therapeutic Service to deliver an Intensive Intervention, followed by a period of Monitoring and Maintenance, with young people, their families and networks, to support change that sustainably reduces the need for Care and enables young people to safely remain living with their family. The Therapeutic Service will work, in a collaborative and complementary way, with other services including Suffolk County Council’s allocated case-holding Social Worker / Early Help Practitioner, schools / education services, health services and other specialist services in meeting the needs of the young person and their family. The Intensive Intervention will be a recognised evidence-based approach, or combination of such approaches, such as Functional Family Therapy (FFT), Multi-Systemic Therapy (MST), Triple P, Solution Focused-Brief Therapy (SFBT) or similar. This Tender does not prescribe the approach, but asks for this to be described in the Method Statement as part of the Tender response. Internal review indicates that Functional Family Therapy or a similar approach would be a potentially good fit. The Service Provider will have experience of delivering the evidence-based approach and must achieve practitioner training and site certification, as appropriate to the practice model identified and the delivery of this contract within a reasonably practicable period from the start of the Contract. Suffolk County Council have been awarded a grant in principle by the Life Chances Fund to make a partial contribution to the Outcome Payments of an Outcomes Based Contract seeking to reduce Care Entry funded via a Social Impact Bond. Suffolk County Council wishes to make best use of this opportunity with this Tender. The proposed Contract will, therefore, be Outcomes Based (Payments by Results) structured as a Social Impact Bond. This is expected to require the involvement of a Social Investor who will have the necessary expertise to raise investment to fund mobilisation and working capital, and potentially to bear the financial risk of an Outcomes Based Contract. Bidders responding to this Tender should be sufficiently familiar with the concept and operation of an Outcomes Based Contract funded by a Social Impact Bond. Responses to the Tender from organisations based in and/or working with Suffolk and not for profit organisations are particularly welcomed Only one of the Lots will be awarded either Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3. We reserve the right to decide which Lot to award following the evaluation of the bids.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Lodging of appeals Precise Information on deadline(s) for lodging appeals: Suffolk County council incorporates a minimum 10 calendar days standstill period from the point at which information on the award of contract is communicated to the tenderers. This period allows unsuccessful tenderers to seek further debriefing from the Contracting Authority before the contract is entered into. If an appeal regarding the award of contract has not been successfully resolved: The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 as amended provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or at risk of harm by a breach of rules, to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland). Any such action must be brought promptly.
